title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Oil prices hit multiyear highs above $70 a barrel after OPEC and its allies forecast higher demand and boosted output, punctuating an economic reawakening that has lifted prices of a broad range of commodities.

---

Meatpacker JBS was struck by a ransomware attack that took a large chunk of U.S. beef-and-pork processing offline.

---

Amazon recently updated its terms of service to allow customers to file lawsuits, dropping its arbitration requirement for disputes.

---

Fresh signs are emerging that business travel may be about to pick up, encouraging airlines, which rely on it for a huge share of their revenue.

---

The SEC told Tesla last year that CEO Musk's use of Twitter had twice violated a court-ordered policy requiring his tweets to be preapproved by company lawyers.

---

AMC's shares soared after the company disclosed that it took advantage of a skyrocketing stock price last week to sell shares to a hedge fund for $230.5 million.

---

The Supreme Court declined to hear a J&J appeal against a $2.1 billion judgment awarded to 20 women who alleged the company's talcum baby powder caused cancer.

---

The Dow posted a gain of 0.1%, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq slipped 0.05% and 0.1%, respectively.

---

China's top trade negotiator spoke with Yellen via videoconference in what the U.S. termed an introductory meeting.
